name: DataRepository

properties.name: dataset
properties.sdo_desc: A dataset contained in this catalog. Inverse property: includedInDataCatalog.

properties.name: citation
properties.sdo_desc: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

properties.name: dateModified
properties.sdo_desc: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

properties.name: fileFormat
properties.sdo_desc: Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

properties.name: keywords
properties.sdo_desc: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

properties.name: license
properties.sdo_desc: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

properties.name: provider
properties.sdo_desc: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller. Supersedes carrier.

properties.name: publication
properties.sdo_desc: A publication event associated with the item.

properties.name: sourceOrganization
properties.sdo_desc: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

properties.name: identifier
properties.sdo_desc: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

subtitle: Bioschemas specification for describing data repositories and data catalogues in the life-sciences.
description:
This document covers the schema.org and bioschemas.org properties necessary to describe data repositories, catalogues and databases in the life sciences, organised by their requirement level (M for mandatory, R for recommended and O for optional) and driven by a set of use cases. A simple example in JSON-LD is also provided. The majority of these fields already exist in schema.org, others are pending. 
Note that this draft will be improved progressively through the bioschemas process.
